decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It capitalizes on synergy between spirits and utilizes disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spell Queller to control the tempo of the game. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and surprise the opponent. The deck aims to maintain pressure while protecting its creatures with Selfless Spirit and Drogskol Captain, ultimately aiming to finish off the opponent swiftly with Geist of Saint Traft and other evasive threats.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) in order to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for powerful late game plays. The deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated, while also using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to search for key pieces of the Tron lands. In addition, there are powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to close out the game once the Tron lands are assembled.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures. By efficiently playing spells that deal damage directly to the opponent, while also controlling the board with removal spells, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to respond to the threats on the battlefield, while also maintaining a consistent stream of burn spells to finish them off.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, ultimately aiming to outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Negate, Cryptic Command, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value for itself. With a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck can handle a wide range of threats. The mana base is designed to provide access to all necessary colors while also having utility lands like Field of Ruin for additional disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, allowing you to return creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. Using cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting, you can set up explosive turns where you dredge through your deck and close out the game with cards like Conflagrate. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and aggressive creatures, making it a powerful combo deck in the Modern format.

The main focus of the deck is to control the opponent's board and hand by utilizing counter spells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while digging through the library for key cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The win condition is to gain advantage through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with superior card advantage and board control. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently controlling the game and establishing a dominant board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of Human creatures onto the battlefield using cards like Aether Vial and Unclaimed Territory. By leveraging the power of synergistic Human tribal effects, such as Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and aggressive creature-based strategies. Cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter provide disruption and control elements, while Noble Hierarch helps to accelerate the deck's mana base. The key strategy revolves around efficiently building a strong board presence and applying consistent pressure to opponents.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with cheap creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Bloodghast, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to control the board. Additionally, the deck has delve creatures like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler to provide additional threats. The key strategy is to quickly put pressure on the opponent and deal as much damage as possible before they can stabilize and take control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early on by casting powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. By using cards like Serum Powder and Gemstone Caverns to ensure a fast start and disruption cards like Chalice of the Void and Ghost Quarter to control the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to win the game with efficient and powerful creatures before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main focus of this Mardu Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state while keeping up the pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck combines discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek with disruptive spells like Dreadbore and Lightning Bolt to control the board. Lingering Souls and Young Pyromancer provide a steady stream of threats, while Bedlam Reveler helps replenish your hand. The deck also utilizes the disruptive power of Blood Moon to restrict the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent quickly with a swarm of Human creatures, taking advantage of cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to grow your board presence. By utilizing Aether Vial and Unclaimed Territory, you can accelerate your mana and deploy threats efficiently. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts your opponent's spells, while Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage provide disruption and versatility. Mantis Rider and Kitesail Freebooter offer flying threats and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays supported by efficient removal and disruptive spells. By ramping up with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to play powerful threats like Spell Queller and Knight of the Reliquary early on. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and control, while Settle the Wreckage and Path to Exile handle opposing threats. With a mix of creatures, planeswalkers, and spells, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, then utilize graveyard recursion effects to bring them back to the battlefield for explosive combo plays. Key cards like Bridge from Below, Vengevine, and Gravecrawler work together to create a powerful board presence that can overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Greater Gargadon and Walking Ballista provide alternative win conditions or ways to control the board. This deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents through a synergistic mix of graveyard interactions and combo potential.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the battlefield with aggressive Human creatures, using cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider to build a strong board presence. The deck takes advantage of cards like Aether Vial, Unclaimed Territory, and Cavern of Souls to efficiently cast creatures, and uses disruptive creatures like Kitesail Freebooter and Meddling Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disruptive strategies in order to win the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively swarm the battlefield with cheap artifacts and creatures while utilizing affinity for artifacts to power out big threats quickly. This deck focuses on quickly equipping Cranial Plating to deal massive damage, using Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp out multiple threats early on. By utilizing powerful creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer, the deck can overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient beats. Karn, Scion of Urza provides card advantage and Master of Etherium buffs up the team, creating a versatile and powerful aggro deck.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This enables the player to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck aims to control the game through board wipes like Oblivion Stone, disruption with Ghost Quarter, and graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus. The deck's win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats and outvalue them in the late game.
